page.title: 01South Tyne to Roman Wall
page.content: Area predominately farmland, partially within the Northumberland national park. The main A69 trunk route and the Newcastle Carlisle railway (off grid) run through the area to the south and at the north lies the Roman Wall and the course of the Stonegate Roman Road. The farms are mainly sheep rearing with some cattle which have to be kept indoors in the winter. There is one public house which serves the scatterd local community. The historic monuments - Roman remains - are explained in the National Park Information Centre. There is a Youth Hostel which caters for students etc visiting the Wal.Meltridge is the only village in the area, just a small one, with no services at all.The bus passes through so does the train but there is no station
